[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
I feel so grateful to have a boss who is always so supportive of me.

[MEMORY]
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'Friendship and Collaboration', 'Related Summaries': 'Co-workers A and Co-workers B discuss their friendship and successful collaboration on set.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Co-workers A: Can you believe that we met on set and now we're such good friends? ### Co-workers B: It's crazy how things work out sometimes. I never would have thought that I'd meet one of my closest friends on a movie set. ### Co-workers A: Yeah, it's funny because before we started working together, I was a little intimidated by you. ### Co-workers B: Really? Why is that? ### Co-workers A: Well, you're such a talented director and I was nervous about making a good impression. But once we started working together, I realized how down-to-earth and easy to work with you are. ### Co-workers B: That's sweet of you to say. I was actually a bit nervous about working with you because I knew you were a talented actor. ### Co-workers A: Aw, thanks! I feel like we were both able to bring out the best in each other during the shoot. ### Co-workers B: Definitely. I think our collaboration is what made the movie such a success. ### Co-workers A: And now that it's done, I can't wait to see what project we get to work on next. ### Co-workers B: Same here. We make a great team. Who knows, maybe we'll even start our own production company someday.' }(2) {'Related Topics': 'Facing Fears and Managing Frustrations', 'Related Summaries': 'Co-workers A discusses facing fears, managing frustrations, and seeking healthier coping mechanisms with Co-workers B.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Co-workers A: I was so embarrassed yesterday. I saw a spider on my way to work and freaked out in front of everyone. ### Co-workers B: Really? I didn't know you were scared of spiders. ### Co-workers A: Yeah, ever since I was a kid. I remember running to my mom and dad whenever I saw one. ### Co-workers B: That's understandable. I mean, some people just have a fear of certain things. ### Co-workers A: Remember when I blew up the rabbit with dynamite? I think I was frustrated with myself and took it out on the poor thing. ### Co-workers B: Yeah, I remember you regretting that decision later on. It's important to find healthy ways to deal with our frustrations. ### Co-workers A: You're right. I need to work on that more. Maybe I can try some relaxation techniques or find a hobby to de-stress. ### Co-workers B: Definitely. It's all about finding what works for you. And maybe facing your fear of spiders can be a part of that process.' }
```
